item.title: 'Ready to step up': VP Harris gains Capitol Hill cheerleaders as Biden isolates with Covid
item.description: President Biden has faced growing pressure from Democrats to drop out of the race after his June debate flop against Donald Trump.

item.title: Flight cancellations ease after IT outage but disruptions continue
item.description: The Crowdstrike-Mircosoft outage forced thousands of flight cancellations and delays.

item.title: Malicious actors trying to exploit global tech outage for their own gain
item.description: Government cybersecurity agencies around the world are warning about new phishing schemes targeting businesses and individuals affected by the outage.

item.description: Get the lowdown on a financial adviser before you give them a dime.

item.title: AOC rallies to Biden's side as progressives split over backing his 2024 campaign
item.description: The New York progressive has emerged as an unexpected voice speaking out against the Democratic ‚Äúdonors‚Äù and ‚Äúelites‚Äù she says are trying to push the president out.

item.title: Microsoft says about 8.5 million of its devices affected by CrowdStrike-related outage
item.description: The global tech outage "affected 8.5 million Windows devices, or less than one percent of all Windows machines," Microsoft said in a blog post on Saturday.

item.title: CrowdStrike outage affected 8.5 million Windows devices, Microsoft says
item.description: Microsoft said Saturday it estimates that worldwide about 8.5 million computers were disabled by the outage caused by an update from the Texas based cyber security company, CrowdStrike on Friday.

item.title: Trump ally Allen Weisselberg released from jail
item.description: Weisselberg, the former chief financial officer of the Trump Organization, was sentenced in April to five months behind bars after he pleaded guilty to two counts of perjury.

item.title: CrowdStrike update that caused global outage likely skipped checks, experts say
item.description: CrowdStrike's routine update of its widely used cybersecurity software caused clients' computer systems to crash globally on Friday.

item.title: Senate Finance chair Sherrod Brown calls on Biden to drop out, joins over 30 lawmakers
item.description: President Joe Biden for weeks has resisted calls to step aside and let another Democrat run for the White House against Donald Trump, the Republican nominee.

item.title: China's Xi urges all-out rescue efforts after highway bridge collapse kills 11
item.description: As of 10 a.m. on Saturday, five vehicles were confirmed to have fallen into the water and 30 people were reported missing, state media said.
